article_title: Debt ceiling: Are markets afraid the U.S. will default?
article_text:

twitter.description: Debt ceiling crises are old hat for the American public. Ever since the Republican Party took over the House of Representatives, it has seen the debt ceiling as the single best negotiating tool for...
twitter.title: Are markets scared of a U.S. default?

article_metadata.keywords: debt ceiling, default, treasuries, jack lew, republicans, freedom caucus, prioritization, congress, republicans, republican party
article_metadata.sailthru.tags: debt ceiling, default, freedom caucus, Investor's Guide, Jack Lew, prioritization, Republicans, treasuries
article_metadata.description: Despite heightened rhetoric from Republicans about raising the debt ceiling, markets were more jittery in past years over a possible default.
